jobDescription: Job ID 11578  Type Temporary Full-Time  Company Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center  Location US-WA-Seattle  Category Philanthropy and Fundraising  Overview  Cures Start Here. At Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, home to three Nobel laureates, interdisciplinary teams of world-renowned scientists seek new and innovative ways to prevent, diagnose and treat cancer, HIV/AIDS and other life-threatening diseases. Fred Hutch's pioneering work in bone marrow transplantation led to the development of immunotherapy, which harnesses the power of the immune system to treat cancer. An independent, nonprofit research institute based in Seattle, Fred Hutch houses the nation's first cancer prevention research program, as well as the clinical coordinating center of the Women's Health Initiative and the international headquarters of the HIV Vaccine Trials Network. Careers Start Here.  Summary  The Advancement Services team manages and analyzes an extensive donor/prospect database with 500,000 constituent and prospect records. The 21-member team helps maintain and strengthen Philanthropy's infrastructure while stressing the importance of quality data collection and gift handling, outstanding prospect research and management, valuable analytics, innovative software integration and database integrity.  The Data Analyst role's primary responsibilities include performing statistical analyses of donor information, building and testing predictive model prototypes that can be further developed into operational software, and actively participating in stakeholder discussions focusing on leveraging machine learning methodologies in Advancement Services. The Data Analyst will apply prior experience with machine learning to assess how effective various techniques might be when applied to donor data. This is a temp position for a short-term analytical project.  Reporting  The Data Analyst reports to the Chief Philanthropy Executive, Advancement Services Responsibilities Job Responsibilities Development of machine learning prototypes to explore accuracy and complexity of predictive modeling using donor informationCreate a series of reports using descriptive statistics that describe correlations (and non-correlations) between donor featuresApply standard machine learning methods of regression, clustering, classification and others to sample data sets to assess how effective they might be in various predictive scenariosQualificationsMinimum QualificationsBS in computer science, engineering, the physical sciences or equivalent experienceStrong mathematical background in statistics, linear algebra, calculus and modelingData science course work, e.g. UW PCE Certificate, Springboard MOOC, etc.Experience with machine learning, including regression, clustering and classificationStrong experience with data cleaning, ETL and data visualizationFamiliarity with continuous, discrete, logistic and categorical data setsPython, SQL, R, Tableau, Octave GNU and Excel skills required Preferred Requirements / Experience Healthcare and research analysis experienceNon-profit analysis experienceBlackbaud product suite experience Our Commitment to Diversity  We are committed to cultivating a workplace in which diverse perspectives and experiences are welcomed and respected. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and VEVRAA Employer.
